content:
ServiceManager Class

In this Article

Implements stem.IserviceProvider and provides access to services offered by the editing context.

Syntax

Declaration

public abstract class ServiceManager : IServiceProvider, System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<Type>

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • ServiceManager

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
,
ToString()

Remarks

Services represent functionality that is either provided by the host for the designer to use or that is used by the designer to make functionality available to all designers within the editor. It is obtained from the EditingContext by the Services property.

Constructors summary

ServiceManager()

Initializes a new instance of the ServiceManager class.

Methods summary

Contains(Type)

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the service manager contains a service of the given type.
Contains<TServiceType>()

Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the service manager contains a service of the given type.
GetEnumerator()

Retrieves an enumerator that can be used to enumerate all of the services that this service manager publishes.
GetRequiredService<TServiceType>()

Retrieves the requested service.
GetService(Type)

Retrieves the requested service. This method returns null if the service could not be located.
GetService<TServiceType>()

Retrieves the requested service. This method returns null if the service could not be located.
GetTarget(Delegate)

A helper method that returns the target object for a delegate. If the delegate was created to proxy a generic delegate, this will correctly return the original object, not the proxy.
Publish(Type,PublishServiceCallback)

Publishes the specified service type, but does not declare an instance. When the service is requested, the Publish service callback will be invoked to create the instance. The callback is invoked only once. After that, the instance it returned is cached.
Publish(Type,Object)

Publishes the given service. After it is published, the service instance remains in the service manager until the editing context is disposed of.
Publish<TServiceType>(PublishServiceCallback<TServiceType>)

Publishes the given service type, but does not declare an instance yet. When the service is requested, the PublishServiceCallback will be invoked to create the instance. The callback is invoked only once. After that, the instance it returned is cached.
Publish<TServiceType>(TServiceType)

Publishes the given service. After it is published, the service instance remains in the service manager until the editing context is disposed of.
RemoveCallback(Delegate,Delegate)

A helper method that performs a Delegate.Remove operation, and unwraps delegates that are proxies to generic callbacks. You should use this method in your stem.Activities.Presentation.ServiceManager.UnSubscribe* implementations.
Subscribe(Type,SubscribeServiceCallback)

Invokes the provided callback when someone has published the requested service. If the service was already available, this method invokes the callback immediately.
Subscribe<TServiceType>(SubscribeServiceCallback<TServiceType>)

Invokes the provided callback when someone has published the requested service. If the service was already available, this method invokes the callback immediately.
Unsubscribe(Type,SubscribeServiceCallback)

Removes a subscription for a service type.
Unsubscribe<TServiceType>(SubscribeServiceCallback<TServiceType>)

Removes a subscription for a service type.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

Retrieves an enumerator that can be used to enumerate all of the services that this service manager publishes.

Constructors

  • ServiceManager()

    Initializes a new instance of the ServiceManager class.

    protected ServiceManager ();

Methods

  • Contains(Type)

    Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the service manager contains a service of the given type.

    public abstract bool Contains (Type serviceType);

    Parameters

    • serviceType
      Type

      The type of service to check.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if a service of type serviceType has been published; otherwise, false.

  • Contains<TServiceType>()

    Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the service manager contains a service of the given type.

    public bool Contains<TServiceType> ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if a service of type serviceType has been published; otherwise, false.

  • GetEnumerator()

    Retrieves an enumerator that can be used to enumerate all of the services that this service manager publishes.

    public abstract System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator<Type> GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator<Type>

      Returns stem.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1, which contains an enumeration of published services.

  • GetRequiredService<TServiceType>()

    Retrieves the requested service.

    public TServiceType GetRequiredService<TServiceType> ();

    Returns

    • TServiceType

      Returns a generic type, which is an instance of the service.

    Exceptions

    • NotSupportedException

      There is no service of the given type.

    Remarks

    Unlike GetService, this method throws a NotSupportedException if the service is not available.

  • GetService(Type)

    Retrieves the requested service. This method returns null if the service could not be located.

    public abstract object GetService (Type serviceType);

    Parameters

    • serviceType
      Type

      The type of service to retrieve.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      Returns Object, which is an instance of the service, or null if the service has not been published.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      serviceType is null.

  • GetService<TServiceType>()

    Retrieves the requested service. This method returns null if the service could not be located.

    public TServiceType GetService<TServiceType> ();

    Returns

    • TServiceType

      Returns a generic type, which is an instance of the service, or null if the service has not been published.

  • GetTarget(Delegate)

    A helper method that returns the target object for a delegate. If the delegate was created to proxy a generic delegate, this will correctly return the original object, not the proxy.

    protected static object GetTarget (Delegate callback);

    Parameters

    • callback
      Delegate

      The delegate to get the target for.

    Returns

    • System.Object

      Returns Object, which is the callback target. This can return null if the callback represents a static object.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      callback is null.

  • Publish(Type,PublishServiceCallback)

    Publishes the specified service type, but does not declare an instance. When the service is requested, the Publish service callback will be invoked to create the instance. The callback is invoked only once. After that, the instance it returned is cached.

    public abstract void Publish (Type serviceType, System.Activities.Presentation.PublishServiceCallback callback);

    Parameters

    • serviceType
      Type

      The type of service to publish.

    • callback
      PublishServiceCallback

      A callback that will be invoked when an instance of the service is needed.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      serviceType or callback is null.

    • ArgumentException

      serviceType has already been published.

  • Publish(Type,Object)

    Publishes the given service. After it is published, the service instance remains in the service manager until the editing context is disposed of.

    public abstract void Publish (Type serviceType, object serviceInstance);

    Parameters

    • serviceType
      Type

      The type of service to publish.

    • serviceInstance
      System.Object

      An instance of the service.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      serviceType or serviceInstance is null.

    • ArgumentException

      serviceInstance does not derive from or implement serviceType, or serviceType has already been published.

  • Publish<TServiceType>(PublishServiceCallback<TServiceType>)

    Publishes the given service type, but does not declare an instance yet. When the service is requested, the PublishServiceCallback will be invoked to create the instance. The callback is invoked only once. After that, the instance it returned is cached.

    public void Publish<TServiceType> (System.Activities.Presentation.PublishServiceCallback<TServiceType> callback);

    Parameters

    • callback
      PublishServiceCallback

      A callback that will be invoked when an instance of the service is needed.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      callback is null.

  • Publish<TServiceType>(TServiceType)

    Publishes the given service. After it is published, the service instance remains in the service manager until the editing context is disposed of.

    public void Publish<TServiceType> (TServiceType serviceInstance);

    Parameters

    • serviceInstance
      TServiceType

      An instance of the service.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      serviceInstance is null.

  • RemoveCallback(Delegate,Delegate)

    A helper method that performs a Delegate.Remove operation, and unwraps delegates that are proxies to generic callbacks. You should use this method in your stem.Activities.Presentation.ServiceManager.UnSubscribe* implementations.

    protected static Delegate RemoveCallback (Delegate existing, Delegate toRemove);

    Parameters

    • existing
      Delegate

      The existing delegate to remove the callback from.

    • toRemove
      Delegate

      The callback to remove.

    Returns

    • Delegate

      Returns Delegate, which is a new value to assign to the existing delegate.

  • Subscribe(Type,SubscribeServiceCallback)

    Invokes the provided callback when someone has published the requested service. If the service was already available, this method invokes the callback immediately.

    public abstract void Subscribe (Type serviceType, System.Activities.Presentation.SubscribeServiceCallback callback);

    Parameters

    • serviceType
      Type

      The type of service to subscribe to.

    • callback
      SubscribeServiceCallback

      A callback that will be notified when the service is available.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      serviceType or callback is null.

  • Subscribe<TServiceType>(SubscribeServiceCallback<TServiceType>)

    Invokes the provided callback when someone has published the requested service. If the service was already available, this method invokes the callback immediately.

    public void Subscribe<TServiceType> (System.Activities.Presentation.SubscribeServiceCallback<TServiceType> callback);

    Parameters

    • callback
      SubscribeServiceCallback

      A callback that will be notified when the service is available.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      callback is null.

  • Unsubscribe(Type,SubscribeServiceCallback)

    Removes a subscription for a service type.

    public abstract void Unsubscribe (Type serviceType, System.Activities.Presentation.SubscribeServiceCallback callback);

    Parameters

    • serviceType
      Type

      The type of service to remove the subscription from.

    • callback
      SubscribeServiceCallback

      The callback object to remove from the subscription.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      serviceType or callback is null.

  • Unsubscribe<TServiceType>(SubscribeServiceCallback<TServiceType>)

    Removes a subscription for a service type.

    public void Unsubscribe<TServiceType> (System.Activities.Presentation.SubscribeServiceCallback<TServiceType> callback);

    Parameters

    • callback
      SubscribeServiceCallback

      The callback object to remove from the subscription.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      callback is null.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IEnumerable.GetEnumerator()

    Retrieves an enumerator that can be used to enumerate all of the services that this service manager publishes.

    System.Collections.IEnumerator IEnumerable.GetEnumerator ();

    Returns

    • IEnumerator

      Returns IEnumerator, which contains an enumeration of published services.
